rules: Rule1: Provided that bacteria contaminates food, bacteria reproduces in food.
Rule2: Whenever bacteria contaminates food, bacteria produces enzyme.
Rule3: Under the condition that bacteria contaminates food, food does not contain toxin.
Rule4: Either bacteria contaminates food or research is grant-funded.
Rule5: If culture is resistant to antibiotic, then culture’s growth is not inhibited.
Rule6: Either sample is incubated at temperature or sample is refrigerated at temperature.
Rule7: Supposing sample is refrigerated at temperature, research is grant-funded.
Rule8: If culture grows from sample, then research is grant-funded.
Rule9: Either protocol is followed for A or protocol is violated for A.
Rule10: In case protocol is violated for A, if it is not the case that if sample is not incubated at temperature then culture grows from sample, then if sample is contaminated, sample is discarded.

Rule11: Assuming technician is trained in protocol, if protocol is followed for A, then if it is not the case that if sample is not incubated at temperature then culture grows from sample, then if sample is contaminated, sample is discarded.
Rule12: Either technician is trained in protocol or technician is untrained in protocol.

Rule13: Under the condition that technician is untrained in protocol, if protocol is followed for A, then if it is not the case that if sample is not incubated at temperature then culture grows from sample, then if sample is contaminated, sample is discarded.
Rule14: Provided that technician mislabels sample, label matches sample.
Rule15: If technician is careful, then when technician mislabels sample, label does not match sample.
Rule16: Supposing technician is careless, if technician mislabels sample, then label does not match sample.
Rule17: If identification is incorrect, then identification is not correct.
Rule18: Assuming technician confuses species, identification is incorrect.
Rule19: Whenever enzyme degrades nutrient, food contains toxin.
Rule20: Assuming researcher observes growth, if bacteria produces enzyme, then enzyme degrades nutrient.
Rule21: In case researcher measures rate, researcher observes growth.
Rule22: Provided that researcher records data, researcher measures rate.
Rule23: If technician wears gloves, then if either lab is not sterile or lab does not have isolated bacteria, then container is opened.
Rule24: Whenever technician washes hands, hands are clean.
Rule25: If technician is senior, then when technician touches sample, hands are not clean.
Rule26: Under the condition that technician is junior, if technician touches sample, then hands are not clean.
Rule27: Assuming supervisor supervises technician, technician is senior.
Rule28: Either supervisor supervises technician or assistant assists technician.
Rule29: In case assistant assists technician, technician is junior.
Rule30: Provided that sequencer sequences DNA, microscope identifies bacteria.
Rule31: Either researcher uses microscope or if bacteria does not reproduce in food implies food contains toxin, then sequencer sequences DNA.
Rule32: If researcher notes contamination, then if sample is not incubated at temperature implies culture grows from sample, then sample is contaminated.
Rule33: Whenever researcher is senior, researcher notes contamination.
Rule34: Either researcher is senior or researcher is junior.
Rule35: Assuming researcher misses detail, observation is not accurate.
Rule36: Either researcher is thorough or if researcher rushes, then researcher misses detail.
Rule37: In case peer reviews data, researcher is not thorough.
Rule38: Whenever culture is tested with antibiotic, culture’s growth is inhibited.
Rule39: Under the condition that sample is not incubated at temperature implies culture grows from sample, sample is not contaminated.
Rule40: If it is not the case that if container is labeled then container is sealed, then technician mislabels sample.
Rule41: Assuming it is not the case that either technician is careful or technician is careless, identification is correct.
Rule42: Provided that it is not the case that either technician is careful or technician is careless, technician confuses species.
Rule43: Whenever bacteria does not reproduce in food implies food contains toxin, lab has isolated bacteria.
Rule44: In case either lab is not sterile or lab does not have isolated bacteria, container is labeled.
Rule45: Whenever either lab is not sterile or lab does not have isolated bacteria, colony is visible.
Rule46: If either lab is not sterile or lab does not have isolated bacteria, then container is not opened.
Rule47: Supposing either lab is not sterile or lab does not have isolated bacteria, colony is not visible.
Rule48: Under the condition that it is not the case that if researcher is junior then researcher notes contamination, observation is accurate.
Rule49: If it is not the case that if researcher is junior then researcher notes contamination, researcher rushes.
Rule50: In case bacteria is not resistant to antibiotic implies bacteria is not pathogenic, culture is tested with antibiotic.
Rule51: Provided that culture is not tested with antibiotic implies culture is resistant to antibiotic, bacteria has mutated.
Rule52: If culture is not tested with antibiotic implies culture is resistant to antibiotic, bacteria has not mutated.
Rule53: Supposing it is not the case that if sample is not incubated at temperature implies culture grows from sample, then if sample is contaminated, sample is not discarded.
Rule54: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if researcher studies bacteria then researcher records data, then experiment is repeated, results are published.
Rule55: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that if researcher studies bacteria then researcher records data, then experiment is repeated, results are not published.
Rule56: Provided that technician does not wear gloves, technician washes hands.
Rule57: In case research is not grant-funded, bacteria is pathogenic.
Rule58: Whenever research is not grant-funded, bacteria is resistant to antibiotic.
facts: Fact6: Microscope does not identify bacteria.
Fact8: Researcher does not use microscope.
